text: [Music]
[Applause]
[Music]
hello i am shukdev a cloud support
engineer here at the aws office in
sydney today i'm going to show you how
users can troubleshoot failed amazon
elastic compute cloud register jobs
using aws backup
let's get started to troubleshoot this
issue
as you go to restore your ec2 instances
from the recovery point in aws backup
you might see the message you're not
authorized to perform this operation
please check the permission associated
with your aws backup rules and refer to
the aws backup documentation for more
details
this error of non-authorization can
occur under following conditions the
original ec2 instance has an instance
profile attached to it or you're trying
to restore the instance on the aws
backup console using setting default
role for restore role and restore with
original iam role for instance aws
identity and access management role
there are two ways to resolve this issue
you can use the proceed with no i am
role option or the restore with original
i am role option
let's try the proceed with no i am role
option
when i attempt to register jobs for the
instance in the aws backup console
select proceed with no i am role for
instance i am role
with this option you can restore the
instance but the restored instance
doesn't have an instance profile
attached to it later you can attach the
instance profile to the restored
instance
the second method is to use the restore
with original i am roll option
when you run the restore job you can
select restore with original i am roll
for instance i am roll
after attaching additional permissions
to your restore role
if you know the role that you used for
the restore you can open the im console
and create the following im policy
don't forget to change your aws account
id in the roles resource aren
then attach this policy to your restore
role
if you don't know the role that you used
for restore you must decode the encoded
error message you received using decode
authorization message api call with the
aws command line interface to find the
role that was used to restore the
instance
if you're using a linux based operating
system you can combine this command with
the jq tool to get a viewer friendly
output
if you receive errors while running the
preceding aws command
make sure that you are using the latest
version of the aws cli
you receive the following output that
shows you where to retrieve the role
the example output shows that the
restore role is same as aws backup
default service role
the restore role must have the i am
pastoral permission so that it can
interact with the role ecs instance role
because this role is required
to restore the instance that you created
earlier
after you attach the policy to your
restore role
you can now run the restore job again
and restore the instance
thanks for watching and happy cloud
competing from all of us here at aws
[Music]
[Applause]
[Music]
[Music]
